intro: Brossaea anastomosans, commonly known as the threadleaf dandelion, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that develop into fluffy, white seed heads, typical of the genus Taraxacum. Its leaves are narrow, thread-like, and often have a hairy texture. Brossaea anastomosans thrives in grassy areas and is adapted to arid and semi-arid climates.
